description:
## Overview
[github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s](https://github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s) is a package that automates the deployment, provisioning, management, and orchestration of Elasticsearch, Kibana and APM Server on Kubernetes based on the operator pattern.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cryptographic Issues. A weak random number generator is used for generating passwords. If an attacker is able to determine when the current Elastic Stack cluster was deployed they may be able to more easily brute force the Elasticsearch credentials generated by ECK.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s` to version 1.1.0 or higher.
## References
- [Elastic Security Announcements](https://www.elastic.co/community/security/)
title: Cryptographic Issues

description:
## Overview
[github.com/lightningnetwork/lnd](https://github.com/lightningnetwork/lnd) is a complete implementation of a Lightning Network node.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Access Control. A lightning node accepting a channel must check that the funding transaction output does indeed open the channel proposed.  Otherwise an attacker can claim to open a channel but either not pay to the peer, or not pay the full amount. Once that transaction reaches the minimum depth, it can spend funds from the channel. The victim will only notice when it tries to close the channel and none  of the commitment or mutual close transactions it has are valid.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/lightningnetwork/lnd` to version 0.7.1-beta or higher.
## References
- [Linux Foundation Vuln Tracker](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/lightning-dev/2019-September/002174.html)
title: Improper Access Control

description:
## Overview
[github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent/consul/fsm](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul) is a tool for service discovery and configuration.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insecure Permissions. Consul fails to enforce changes to legacy ACL token rules due to non-propagation to secondary data centers.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent/consul/fsm` to version 1.6.6, 1.7.4 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Changelog 1.6.6](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/blob/v1.6.6/CHANGELOG.md)
- [GitHub Changelog 1.7.4](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/blob/v1.7.4/CHANGELOG.md)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/commit/98eea08d3ba1b220a14cf6eedf3b6b07ae2795d7)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/issues/5606)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/pull/8047)
title: Insecure Permissions

description:
## Overview
[github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pkg/server/serverpb](https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach) is an open source, cloud-native SQL database.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Authorization. A non-admin authenticated user can call any admin endpoint, even if they should be admin-only operations, as long as the endpoint is visible over HTTP. It makes it possible for non-admin users to shut down a node or view SQL objects on which they have no permission.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pkg/server/serverpb` to version 19.1.16, 19.2.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/issues/42567)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pull/42563)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pull/42726)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pull/42727)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pull/42910)
title: Improper Authorization

description:
## Overview
[github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pkg/registry/pod](https://godoc.org/gopkg.in/kubernetes/kubernetes.v0/pkg/registry/pod) is a package that provides Registry interface and its RESTStorage implementation for storing Pod api objects.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure. Allows remote attackers to read arbitrary pod logs via a container name.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pkg/registry/pod` to version 1.2.0-alpha.5 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/afd56495a1052a3387b81df1786a8d0f51bc8671)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/17886)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/releases/tag/v1.2.0-alpha.5)
title: Information Exposure

description:
## Overview
[github.com/helm/helm/pkg/plugin](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/helm/helm/pkg/plugin) is a package manager for Kubernetes.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. Plugin names are not sanitized properly. As a result, a malicious plugin author could use characters in a plugin name that would result in unexpected behaviour, such as duplicating the name of another plugin or spoofing the output to `helm --help`.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/helm/helm/pkg/plugin` to version 2.16.11, 3.3.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/helm/helm/security/advisories/GHSA-m54r-vrmv-hw33)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/809e2d999e2c33e20e77f6bff30652d79c287542)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/c8d6b01d72c9604e43ee70d0d78fadd54c2d8499)
title: Improper Input Validation

description:
## Overview
[github.com/kubernetes/client-go/discovery/cached/disk](https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go) is a Go clients for talking to a kubernetes cluster.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to World Writable Files. When using the cached location specified by the `--cache-dir` option, all cache files written to this directory are written with world-writeable (`rw-rw-rw-`) permissions. The default location of this directory is `$HOME/.kube/http-cache`.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/kubernetes/client-go/discovery/cached/disk` to version 1.12.9 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go/commit/790a4f63632139cf6731014d00a9a8338f1fbd7d)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77874/commits/f228ae3364729caed59087e23c42868454bc3ff4)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/76676)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/77874)
title: World Writable Files

description:
## Overview
[github.com/gorilla/websocket/](https://github.com/gorilla/websocket) is a Go implementation of the WebSocket protocol.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) via an integer overflow in the presence of malicious WebSocket frames.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gorilla/websocket/` to version 1.4.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gorilla/websocket/commit/5b740c29263eb386f33f265561c8262522f19d37)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/gorilla/websocket/pull/537)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/oragono/oragono/irc](https://github.com/oragono/oragono) is a modern, experimental IRC server written in Go.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). It is possible to conduct a Denial of Service attack websocket listeners within `ircconn.go`.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/oragono/oragono/irc` to version 2.3.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/oragono/oragono/commit/8102d1ddb6291ba82e07b77f7160042e7bc3753c)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/oragono/oragono/pull/1226)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/hashicorp/vault-plugin-secrets-gcp/plugin](https://github.com/hashicorp/vault-plugin-secrets-gcp) is a backend plugin to be used with Hashicorp Vault.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. System TTLs were being used instead of the configured backend TTLs for dynamic service accounts. This could potentially lead to dangerous behaviour and deviates from best practices.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/hashicorp/vault-plugin-secrets-gcp/plugin` to version 0.6.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Changelog](https://github.com/hashicorp/vault/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/hashicorp/vault-plugin-secrets-gcp/commit/e43d20870c50f7428dead1411debcec075b35fb4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/hashicorp/vault-plugin-secrets-gcp/pull/85)
title: Improper Input Validation
